lines.text: BIOGRAPHICAL SKETCH
Give the following information for the key personnel and consultants and collaborators. Begin with the principal
investigator/program director. Photocopy this page for each person.
NAME
POSITION TITLE
Vishva M. Dixit, M.D.
Associatc Professor
EDUCATION (Begin with baccalaureate or other initial professional education, such as nursing, and include postdoctoral training.)
YEAR
INSTITUTION AND LOCATION
DEGREE
CONFERRED
FIELD OF STUDY
University of Nairobi Medical School, Nairobi, Kenya
M.D.
Medicine
Washington University School of Medicine, St. Louis, MO
Post-Doc.
Biochemistry
RESEARCH AND/OR PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE: Concluding with present position, list in chronological order previous employment, experience, and honors.
Key personnel include the principal investigator and any other individuals who partcipate in the sclentific development or execution of the project. Key pensonnel
typicay wil include alindividuals with doctoral or other professional degrees, but in some projects will iclude individuals at the masters or baccalaureate level provided
coitee. List, in chronological orde, the tties, all authors, and complete references to al publcatins during the past three years and to representative earier
they contrbute in a substantive way to the scientific development or execution of the project. Include present membership on any Federal Government public advisory
publications pertinent to this application. DO NOT EXCEED TWO PAGES.
Professional Experience:
Medical Student, Univ. of Nairobi Medical School; Nairobi, Kenya
Intern-Kenyatta National Hospital, Department of Medicine
Resident, Pathology and Medicine, Barnes Hospital, St. Louis, MO
Postdoctoral Fellow in Biological Chemistry, Josiah Macy Foundation
Assistant Professor of Pathology, Univ. of Michigan Med. Sch., Ann Arbor, MI
Associate Professor of Pathology, Univ. of Michigan Med. Sch., Ann Arbor, M1
1991-present
Honors and Awards:
1980, Tommy-Adamson Award for best student in Obstetrics and Gynecology; 1980, Kenya Medical Association
Award for best student in Pathology; 1980, Kamala Memorial Award for best overall medical student; 1981, Josiah
Macy Foundation Postdoctoral Fellowship; 1989, American Heart Association Established Investigatorship Award
Bibliography:
PUBLICATIONS
(Selected out of a total of over 80 publications in pccr reviewed
journals, NOT including reviews or textbook chapters):
Selected Representative Publications from the Past 5 years
1. Laherty, C., Gierman, T., Dixir, V.M.: Characterization of the promoter region of the human thrombospondin
genc. DNA sequences within the first intron increasc transcription. J. Biol. Chem. 264:11222-11227 (1989).
2. Yabkowitz, R., Lowe, J.B., Dixit, V.M.: Expression and initial characterization of a recombinant human
thrombospondin heparin binding domain. J. Biol. Chem. 264:10888-10896 (1989).
3. Prochownik, E.V., O'Rourke, K.M., Dixir, V.M.: Expression and analysis of COOH-terminal deletions of the
human thrombospondin molecule. J. Cell Biol. 109:843-852 (1989).
4. Dixit, V.M., Marks,R.M., Sarma,V., Prochownik,E.V.: The antimitogenic action of tumor necrosis factor is
associated with increased AP-1/c-jun proto-oncogcne transcription. J.Biol.Chem. 264(28):16905-16909 (1989).
Dixit, V.M., Grccn, S., Sarma, V., Holzman, L., Wolf, F.W., O'Rourke, K., Ward., P.A., Prochownik, E.V.
Marks, R.M.: Tumor nccrosis factor-α induction of novel gencs in human endothelial cells including a
macrophage specific chemotaxin. J. Biol. Chem. 265:2973-2978 (1990).
6. O'Shea, K.S., Rheinheimer, J.S.T., Dixit, V.M.: Deposition and role of thrombospondin in thc histogcnesis of
thc cerebellar cortex. J. Cell Biol. 110(4):1275-1283 (1990).
7. Opipari, A.W., Boguski, M.S., Dixit, V.M.: Thc A20 cDNA induced by tumor necrosis factor-α encodes a
novel typc of zinc finger protein. J. Biol. Chem. 265:14705-14708 (1990).
Holz.man, L.B., Marks, R.M., Dixir, V.M.: A novel immediatc-carly response gene of endothelium is induced
by cytokines and encodes a secreted protein. Mol. Cell. Biol. 10:5830-5838 (1990).
FF
Numnber pages consecutively at the bottom throughout the application. Do not use suftixes such as 3a, 3b.
(Form Page 4) Page __._.
